text: I was having trouble sleeping just the
idea of effectively becoming a listening
post for our federal government bothered
me tremendously lador Leveson is the
founder of lavabit a secure email
company that routinely cooperated with
law enforcement but when the FBI
discovered that Edward Snowden the NSA
leaker was using the service they
demanded more than Levinson was willing
to provide what was different here was
the lengths to which they were willing
to go in order to collect the
information that they wanted what were
those lanes demanding my ssl keys in
cloying yeah employing a capability that
was highly classified and with that they
could read the emails of all your users
or they could read more than emails they
could intercept usernames they could
intercept passwords credit card
transactions that were going through my
websites logins as well as email and
content and they told me in person that
that's what they wanted to do they saw
it as pursuing a criminal and they
didn't really realize just exactly what
rights they were treading on in order to
do it in the end Levison complied but he
shuddered his company because he could
no longer guarantee privacy to his
customers he is still in court fighting
against the secrecy surrounding
government surveillance agreements with
technology companies we don't know who
to trust can we trust Microsoft symantec
Apple
Yahoo Facebook Google we know that those
companies are working with our
government we know that they get a lot
of money from our government to do
certain things how far are they willing
to go how far have they been forced to
go to weaken their products so that the
government conduct surveillance I know
when I brought that up to the FBI I said
look if I did this for you guys it would
destroy my business if anybody ever
found out what did they say they said
nobody will ever find out it's going to
be kept secret how well did that work
out
